abstract.p: Roundup of recent advertising account changes (S)

block.p: Topp Telecom, Miami, a subsidiary of TelMex, to Bernstein-Rein Advertising, Kansas City, Mo., to handle the account of Tracfone, a prepaid cellular telephone service, which had been at Integer Dallas, part of the Integer Group unit of the Omnicom Group. Spending was estimated at more than $7 million.

Topp Telecom, Miami, a subsidiary of TelMex, to Bernstein-Rein Advertising, Kansas City, Mo., to handle the account of Tracfone, a prepaid cellular telephone service, which had been at Integer Dallas, part of the Integer Group unit of the Omnicom Group. Spending was estimated at more than $7 million.

* Buca Inc.,, Minneapolis, which operates 50 Buca di Beppo restaurants in 18 states and Washington, to Kerker, Minneapolis, formerly Kerker Marketing Communications, as its first agency of record. Billings were estimated at $4 million. * White Rain Company, Danbury, Conn., a subsidiary of the Diamond Products Company, to Marquardt & Roche/Meditz & Hackett, Stamford, Conn., to handle the account of the hair care products marketer, which previously had been owned by Gillette. Billings were estimated at $3 million.
